recipe.title: Szechuan Dan Dan Noodles
recipe.description: A little like a Szechuan style spaghetti bolognese, dan dan noodles are made with a thick, spicy pork sauce full of tongue-numbing Szechuan peppercorns and tangy, pickled vegetables.

directions.step: Wet the peppercorns in your hands, then shake off any excess water. Place the peppercorns on a chopping boards and holding your cleaver in both hands, chop the peppercorns using a back and forth sawing motion. Do this repeatedly until the peppercorns are coarsely ground. It will probably take approximately 3-5 minutes to do this step. Remove the peppercorns to a mixing bowl.

Place the pork on a chopping boards and chop it finely using a series of quick pummeling motions with your cleaver, bringing it back and forth across the pork until it appears finely minced. Place the pork in the bowl with the peppercorns and add the preserved vegetables and soy sauce and mix well. Set aside to marinade for 5 minutes.
Bring a pot of water to the boil on the stove and add the Chinese noodles and salt. Cook the noodles for 2-3 minutes or until cooked through and drain.

Heat the oil up in a wok or wide sautÃ© pan on high heat. Add the pork and stir fry it until it is thoroughly cooked and browned. While it is cooking, mash the pork with your wok ladle or wooden spoon to prevent it clumping up. Remove the pork and set aside.
Add the garlic, ginger and spring onions to the wok and stir fry for 30 seconds. Add the sesame paste, soy sauce, chili paste and stock and simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Divide the noodles between four bowls and ladle the sauce overtop. Add a generous amount of the pork mixture on top and serve hot.

ingredient.name: Chinese sesame paste or dark tahini
